perturbation.original_text: Subcontractor and EDGE shall not be obligated to resolve by arbitration any claim or dispute related to the Agreement. It is mandatory that any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to the Agreement or the breach thereof shall be subject to the jurisdiction of the State of Texas and the venue shall be exclusively in Collin County, Texas for resolution.
perturbation.changed_text:
Subcontractor shall obtain at its own cost and expense and maintain the insurance in full force and effect during the term of the Agreement as required herein. A copy of the (i) certificate(s) of insurance and (ii) endorsements, acceptable to EDGE, shall be submitted to EDGE prior to commencement of any Work and renewals or replacements of such certificates shall be so delivered at least 30 days prior to the expiration or termination of each such policy. A copy of the insurance policies shall promptly be made available to EDGE upon EDGE' request. Subcontractor expressly acknowledges while EDGE retains the right to review the insurance provided by Subcontractor and' Lower-tier Subcontractors, EDGE is not obligated to perform such review. In addition, EDGE exercise of such right is for EDGE' benefit alone and shall confer no rights to Subcontractor or to any third party. EDGE's acceptance of or failure to object to the submitted documents does not constitute approval of coverage that is not in compliance with this Agreement or as acceptance or affirmation of the adequacy or applicability of such insurance.

Subcontractor and EDGE shall not be obligated to resolve by arbitration any claim or dispute related to the Agreement. It is mandatory that any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to the Agreement or the breach thereof shall be subject to the jurisdiction of the State of Texas and the venue shall be exclusively in Collin County, Texas for resolution.
perturbation.explanation: The clause mandating jurisdiction and venue in Collin County, Texas, is a crucial legal provision that should be easily located. Moving this provision to the 'Insurance' section makes it less prominent and harder to find, reducing its enforceability.
perturbation.law_explanation: This section implies that venue provisions should be clear and conspicuous, which is undermined by embedding them within a paragraph detailing insurance requirements. It makes it difficult for a party to quickly identify the applicable venue for dispute resolution.

perturbation.original_text: EDGE shall have the right to suspend the Work in progress for a reasonable time at the direction of Customer. Subcontractor shall resume performance of the Work at EDGE' direction. Subcontractor may be entitled to additional compensation or damages as a consequence of this suspension.
perturbation.changed_text:
EDGE shall have the right to suspend the Work in progress for a reasonable time at the direction of Customer.
Subcontractor agrees to promptly notify EDGE upon learning of any material defect, misstatement or omission in rendering any Work.
Subcontractor shall resume performance of the Work at EDGE' direction. Subcontractor may be entitled to additional compensation or damages as a consequence of this suspension.
perturbation.explanation: By interleaving the 'Notice of Material Defects' clause (originally in section 20) within the 'Suspension of Work' clause (section 12), the clarity and focus of each clause is diminished. This makes it harder to understand the obligations related to each, especially the subcontractor's duty to report defects.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law Contract Interpretation - Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
perturbation.law_explanation: The duty of good faith and fair dealing requires parties to a contract to act honestly and reasonably. Obscuring the notice of material defects clause by placing it inside another section makes it harder for the subcontractor to fulfill their duty to report, thus violating the spirit of good faith.

perturbation.original_text: All claims, disputes and other matters in question arising out of or relating to this subcontract with a breach thereof, except for claims which have been waived by the making or acceptance of final payment, shall be decided by mediation or non-binding arbitration pursuant to the Texas Arbitration Dispute Resolution Act, (Texas Practice and Remedies Code, Chapter 154), and in accordance with the construction industry rules then in effect unless the parties mutually agree otherwise. Each party shall pay its own legal and other costs relating to the mediation or the non- binding arbitration regardless of the outcome of the mediation or the non-binding arbitration.
perturbation.changed_text: All claims, disputes and other matters in question arising out of or relating to this subcontract with a breach thereof, except for claims which have been waived by the making or acceptance of final payment, shall be decided by mediation or non-binding arbitration pursuant to the Texas Arbitration Dispute Resolution Act, (Texas Practice and Remedies Code, Chapter 154), and in accordance with the construction industry rules then in effect unless the parties mutually agree otherwise. The masculine gender shall include the feminine and neuter genders, and the word "person" shall include a corporation, firm, partnership, or other form of association. Each party shall pay its own legal and other costs relating to the mediation or the non- binding arbitration regardless of the outcome of the mediation or the non-binding arbitration.
perturbation.explanation: By inserting the 'Number and Gender' clause (originally in section 29) into the 'Texas Alternative Dispute Resolution' clause (section 26), the focus is shifted from the dispute resolution process to a definition clause. This obscures the dispute resolution process, making it harder for parties to quickly find and understand that section.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Arbitration Act, Tex. Civ. Prac. & Rem. Code § 171.001
perturbation.law_explanation: The Texas Arbitration Act reinforces the validity of arbitration agreements. By embedding the agreement to non-binding arbitration within a clause that is interrupted by a definitional statement, the intent and understanding of the arbitration agreement is diminished, which weakens the enforceability of that agreement.
